data.title: Connected Vehicle Prototype Engineer Resume Southfield, MI
meta_keywords: Experience in Automotive and Motorcycle Prototype connected vehicle mobility engineering
Lead Project Engineer in a Japan cultural environment
Experience in Automotive and Motorcycle Mobile application development
Mobile development skills using Android Studio
data.meta_description: Experience in Automotive and Motorcycle Prototype connected vehicle mobility engineeringLead Project Engineer in a Japan cultural environmentExperience in Automotive and Motorcycle Mobile application development
data.text:
CAREER OBJECTIVE:

To pursue a position in the automotive/motorcycle/mobility industry in which I can utilize and build upon my current knowledge of connected smart mobility engineering.

SUMMARY OF SKILLS:

Experience in Automotive and Motorcycle Prototype connected vehicle mobility engineering

Lead Project Engineer in a Japan cultural environment

Experience in Automotive and Motorcycle Mobile application development

Mobile development skills using Android Studio, openCV, Visual Studio C#, C, Unity, Java, Python, B4X

Mobile development on platforms Android, Linux, Windows, Arduino

WORK EXPERIENCE:

Connected Vehicle Prototype Engineer

Confidential, Southfield, MI

Responsibilities:

Create vehicle to vehicle (V2V), vehicle to motorcycle (V2M) and vehicle to bicycle (V2B) applications using Cellular, DSRC (Dedicated Short Range Communications) and Bluetooth 5 systems.

Initiated and developed smart connected motorcycle applications.

Develop and built in - vehicle prototypes for Smartphone (android) based V2V. This includes prototype hardware and software development with software implementation of wireless, wired, cell phone and internet communication protocols.

Coordinated with Qualcomm to develop applications with DSRC enabled Smartphone.

Develop Motorcycle ARAS (advanced rider assistance systems) prototype applications.

Develop Motorcycle Smart Helmet safety applications.

Develop Confidential Goldwing simulator to demonstrate smart helmet and motorcycle ADAS applications. Simulator designed with Unity software.

Create Augmented Reality (AR) applications for in-vehicle display of potential collisions with pedestrian, motorcyclist and bicyclist.

Develop vehicle to cloud to vehicle Smartphone applications on cellular networks.

Develop Smartphone application to warn bicyclist of approaching vehicles.

Develop computer vision applications for vehicles including thermal infrared.

Develop Light Communication Vehicle to Vehicle prototypes and applications.

Demonstrate application prototypes to Confidential R&D executive management.

Android Application Engineer

Confidential, Mooresville, NC

Responsibilities:

Developed DRIVE, an Android Application for displaying real-time automotive transmission temperature via Bluetooth interface from vehicle OBDII diagnostic port. OBDII Protocols: SAE J1850 (PWM & VPW), ISO 14230-4 (KWP), ISO 15765-4 (CAN). Incorporates Real-Time Graphics, Bluetooth API, Timers and Custom Dialogs.

Developed Safely There, an Android Application that automatically sends a pre-defined text message to a friend or loved one when the user has reached their destination. Incorporates GPS, Google Map API services (JSON), SMS text, Activities and Services within the Android Operating System.safely-there.html

Senior Application Developer

Confidential, Charlotte, NC

Responsibilities:

Developed windows c# application for Nuclear Human Resources (HR) Real-Time Data transaction system.

Application accesses nuclear worker database for both onsite and offsite HR nuclear hosted systems.

The application includes an IBM Websphere message queue for incoming xml messages and IBM DB2 and SQL Server databases.

Application is mission critical for Nuclear HR. Lead developer for the project.

IT Developer

Confidential, Charlotte, NC

Responsibilities:

Developed web-based forms for the Relationship Management System and incentive income reporting tool using Microsoft .NET framework with Active Server Pages (ASP.Net) and the programming language C#.

Mobile Device Engineer

Confidential, Mooresville, NC

Responsibilities:

Pocket PC/Palm OS application for diagnosing Check Engine in automobiles 1996 or newer. (Appforge, Visual Basic.Net). OBDII Protocols: SAE J1850 (PWM & VPW), ISO 14230-4 (KWP), ISO 15765-4 (CAN).

Windows CE/Pocket PC custom applications for bar coding (C#.Net, visual basic.Net, compact framework, SQL CE).

Controls Engineer

Confidential, Mt. Holly, NC

Responsibilities:
